result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James G Howard was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: James G Howard
parties.address: W229 S8530 Big Bend Dr, Big Bend, WI 53103

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance of fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Cash bail applied to restitution.  Restitution is to be paid to Big Bend Food and Beverage.  PAID IN FULL.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Big Bend Police Department.  DNA surcharge and Blood draw fee are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

timeConds.notes:
Non working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions, INCLUDING treatment, church and medical care/appointments.  Employment is not required due to the defendant being retired.
To commence forthwith.
Apply 1 day sentence credit.

records.addlTxt:
Discharge - Regular
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status.  
Discharge date:  01-08-2018
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Character Letter, received and filed in court.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James G Howard in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5  Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5  Years.
Extended Supervision: 2  Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 


36 Months D/L REVOCATION
30 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.


Restitution:  $889.09 (to be paid to Big Bend Food and Beverage - may have already been paid by the defendant's auto insurance) - to be paid within the first 6 months of probation.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to Village of Big Bend Police Department);
FINE:  $1,519
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.



CONDITION TIME:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, including treatment, church and medical care/appointments, work not required due to the defendant being retired).
1 Day Credit.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant can be transferred to Huber.


Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant James G Howard in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant James G Howard in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns for results of blood test.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to have no contact with business or the owner listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant James G Howard in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
